Last updated: November 6, 2025

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

In this document you will find answers to the most common questions about how the UPVX platform works.

1. General

What is UPVX?

UPVX is the MOOC platform of the Universitat Politècnica de València. Here you will find courses created by UPV faculty, covering a wide range of knowledge areas. Content is created using Polimedia technology.

What is a MOOC?

MOOC stands for Massive Open Online Course. It is characterized by being free, accessible, and designed on an Internet educational platform that allows the participation of a large number of students.

Are all UPV MOOCs developed on UPVX?

No. UPV also offers courses on the international platform edx.org, of which it has been a member since 2014. You can access them from the UPVX course search engine, which will redirect you to edX when necessary.

I am not a UPV member, can I take a UPVX course?

Yes. Due to their open nature, UPVX courses are aimed at anyone with Internet access, regardless of whether they are part of the UPV community or not.

What is Polimedia?

Polimedia is a technology developed by UPV to create quality audiovisual content quickly and efficiently.

How do UPVX courses work?

Courses consist of short videos explaining basic concepts, interspersed with self-assessment exercises, discussion forums, and final exams. This structure allows students to review concepts as many times as needed.

2. Students

When does each course start?

UPVX periodically publishes new editions of its courses. You can check the start dates on the platform's homepage.

How many courses can I take?

You can enroll in as many courses as you wish. Each course indicates an estimated weekly dedication, which usually ranges from 2 to 5 hours.

How long does a UPVX course last?

Duration varies by course. Currently, courses last between 2 and 12 weeks, although this may change depending on the subject matter.

Are there deadlines in each course?

It is recommended to follow the scheduled calendar of each edition to take advantage of interaction with other students. At the end of the edition, materials usually remain available as an archived course, although graded exams can no longer be taken.

What material is available in a UPVX course?

Each course offers explanatory videos, supporting documents, and multiple-choice exercises. Additionally, at the end of each unit or course, assessments are included to measure student progress.

What are the requirements to pass a course?

The faculty of each course establishes the evaluation criteria, including the weight of each test and the percentage required to pass the course. This information appears in the course guide.

How do I enroll in a course?

Go to the course page and click "Enroll in the course". To complete enrollment you will need to have an account on the UPVX platform.

3. Certifications

Does UPVX offer certificates?

UPVX courses are completely free and do not offer official certificates. They are designed for educational purposes and knowledge dissemination.

However, UPV courses hosted on edx.org may offer certificates, managed directly through that platform.

UPVX Privacy Policy

This policy explains how the Universitat Politècnica de València (UPV) processes the personal data of users of the UPVX platform (upvx.es), which offers MOOC courses (open and free) based on Open edX.

1. Introduction

On the UPVX platform, accessible at https://upvx.es and operated by the Universitat Politècnica de València (UPV), we process your personal data to manage your user account, your participation in MOOC courses, your academic progress, and other associated services.

This policy describes what data is collected, for what purpose, the legal basis of processing, retention time, possible transfers, and your rights.

The platform is not intended for children under 14 years of age. If you are a minor, you should not register without the express consent of your parents or legal guardians.

2. Data Controller

Universitat Politècnica de València (UPV)
Camí de Vera s/n, 46022 Valencia (Spain)
Contact email: dpd@upv.es (Data Protection Officer)

3. Personal data we process and purposes

3.1. Registration and profile data

During registration or profile editing, UPVX may collect the following data:

  • Name and surname
  • Username / identifier
  • Email address
  • Password (stored encrypted)
  • Age (optional)
  • Country (optional)
  • Education level (optional)
  • Gender (optional)

This data allows us to create your account, identify you as a user, manage your participation in courses, and compile aggregated statistics to improve the service.

3.2. Academic and participation data

During your activity on the platform we collect:

  • Courses you enroll in
  • Progress, grades, assignments, results, and exams
  • Participation in forums and messages sent
  • Course start and end dates

This data is processed to manage teaching activity, verify student participation, conduct pedagogical analysis, and prepare aggregated academic performance reports.

3.3. Technical data and cookies

We automatically collect technical information:

  • IP address, browser, device, and operating system
  • Access and activity logs within the platform
  • Cookies or equivalent technologies (see Cookie Policy)

This data is necessary for technical maintenance, security, incident detection, and service improvement.

4. Legal basis for processing

  • Performance of a contract or service: necessary to manage your registration and participation in courses.
  • Consent: when you voluntarily provide optional data such as age, country, education level, or gender.
  • Legitimate interest: to maintain security, perform internal statistics, and improve educational services.
  • Compliance with legal obligations: regarding retention of academic records or administrative requirements.

5. Data retention

Personal data will be retained as long as you keep your account active or as long as necessary for the purposes of processing.

Once the account is closed, they will be kept blocked for the periods provided by current regulations, and may be kept for statistical or institutional archival purposes, duly anonymized.

6. Communications to third parties and international data transfers

UPV will not transfer your personal data to third parties except in the following cases:

  • Technology service providers: companies that provide services to the platform (e.g., web hosting, technical support, email delivery, or data analysis). They act as data processors, under contract and following UPV instructions, with adequate security and confidentiality guarantees.
  • UPV teaching or research collaborators: exclusively for statistical or academic purposes, and always in aggregated or anonymized format.
  • Legal or administrative obligations: when there is a requirement from competent authorities, public bodies, or court orders.

International transfers: if any service provider is located outside the European Economic Area (EEA), UPV will ensure that such transfers comply with GDPR provisions through:

  • European Commission adequacy decisions
  • Standard contractual clauses approved by the Commission
  • Other legally valid mechanisms that ensure an adequate level of protection

Personal data will never be sold to third parties or used for commercial purposes unrelated to UPVX training activity.

7. User rights

As the data subject, you can exercise the following rights:

  • Access: know what personal data we process.
  • Rectification: request correction of inaccurate data.
  • Erasure: request deletion of your data when no longer necessary.
  • Restriction of processing: restrict the use of your data in certain cases.
  • Objection: object to the processing of your data in certain circumstances.
  • Portability: receive your data in a structured and transferable format.
  • Withdrawal of consent: in cases where processing is based on it.

You can exercise these rights by writing to dpd@upv.es, indicating your request and proving your identity.

If you believe your rights have not been respected, you can file a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency (AEPD).

8. Data security

UPV adopts appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure data security, including encryption, access control, and periodic audits, in accordance with the National Security Scheme and GDPR.

9. Minors

The platform is not intended for children under 14 years of age. If you are a minor, you should not register without the consent of your parents or legal guardians.

10. Modifications to this policy

UPV may update this privacy policy to adapt it to regulatory or technical changes. The date of the last revision will always be shown at the end of the document.

Last updated: November 6, 2025

Cookie Policy

This policy describes the use of cookies and similar technologies on upvx.es (Open edX platform of the Universitat Politècnica de València, hereinafter «UPVX»). Here we explain what they are, what they are used for, what types we use, how you can manage them, and how to exercise your rights.

1. What are cookies?

Cookies are small files that the website places on your device to enable or improve functionalities, remember your preferences, and perform audience measurements. They can be first-party (set by upvx.es) or third-party (set by different domains, such as Google or YouTube when their services are integrated).

Some cookies involve processing of personal data (e.g., IP or online identifiers). Processing is carried out in accordance with GDPR and LOPDGDD. See the UPVX Privacy Policy for more information.

2. Legal basis and consent

At UPVX we use:

  • Technical or necessary cookies: installed without the need for consent because they enable service delivery (e.g., authentication, security, language selection).
  • Analytical cookies (Google Analytics 4) and YouTube cookies: installed only if you give your consent through the initial banner. You can accept or reject them when you first access.

3. Types of cookies we use

● Technical or necessary

Essential for logging in, maintaining the session, applying CSRF security, or remembering the language.

● Analytical and multimedia (require consent)

Usage measurement (Google Analytics 4) and playback of embedded videos (YouTube), which may use Google identifiers.

4. Cookie list

The names, domains, and expiration dates shown below reflect a real example observed on the UPVX homepage and Google's public documentation. They may vary with technical or configuration changes.

4.1. First-party cookies (upvx.es / .upvx.es – Open edX)

Name Domain Purpose Type Duration
csrftoken upvx.es Security. Prevention of CSRF attacks on forms. Technical (necessary) Up to 1 year
sessionid upvx.es Authentication and user session maintenance. Technical (necessary) Session
edx-jwt-cookie-header-payload .upvx.es Authentication. Contains the header and payload of the JWT for Open edX sessions. Technical (necessary) Variable (e.g., hours)
edx-jwt-cookie-signature .upvx.es Integrity. JWT signature to validate authenticity. Technical (necessary) Variable (e.g., hours)
edx-user-info .upvx.es Interface preferences (profile link, image, etc.) of the authenticated user. Functionality Hours/days
edxloggedin .upvx.es Indicates if the session is started to optimize navigation. Functionality Minutes/hours
openedx-language-preference .upvx.es Remembers language preference. Preferences Up to 1 month
course-v1:… / edxCourseRedirect upvx.es Saves the last course or block visited to resume navigation. Functionality Days/weeks

4.2. Analytics cookies (Google Analytics 4)

Installed only with your consent. UPVX uses GA4 to obtain aggregated statistics and improve the service (never to create individual profiles).

Name Domain Purpose Type Duration
_ga upvx.es Identify unique users (client ID) for aggregated metrics. Analytics (consent) 2 years
_ga_<ID> upvx.es Maintain session state and assignment to GA4 container. Analytics (consent) 2 years

4.3. YouTube cookies (third-party)

Installed only if you interact with embedded videos and accept their use. Some are used to remember preferences and, where applicable, for ad personalization by Google/YouTube.

Name Domain Purpose Type Duration
VISITOR_INFO1_LIVE .youtube.com Manage player preferences and visitor information; service issue detection. Multimedia/marketing (consent) ~6 months
YSC .youtube.com Session identifier for video interactions. Multimedia (consent) Session
VISITOR_PRIVACY_METADATA .youtube.com Stores visitor's privacy/consent status on YouTube. Preferences (consent) Up to 6–13 months
SIDCC, SSID, SOCS .google.com / .youtube.com Account security, preferences, and consent status for Google services linked to the player. Multimedia/security (consent) Months / up to 2 years

5. How can you manage or disable cookies?

You can configure, reject, or delete cookies from your browser settings. Keep in mind that technical cookies may be necessary for the website to function properly and, if you block them, some parts may not be available.

All modern browsers allow you to change cookie settings. These settings are usually found in the "Options" or "Preferences" menu of the browser. You can disable them at any time from:

  • Google Chrome: Manage cookies with Chrome
  • Microsoft Edge: Manage cookies with Edge
  • Mozilla Firefox: Manage cookies with Firefox
  • Apple Safari: Manage cookies with Safari

6. International transfers

The use of Google Analytics and YouTube may involve international data transfers by Google LLC. See Google's information on privacy and cookie use to learn about applicable safeguards.

7. Controller and contact

Data controller: Universitat Politècnica de València (UPV). Data Protection Officer: dpd@upv.es.

To exercise your rights of access, rectification, erasure, objection, restriction, or portability, follow the instructions in the Privacy Policy. You can also file a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency.

8. Changes to this policy

This policy may be updated to reflect regulatory or technical changes. We will publish the current version and the date of last update on this same page.

Last updated: November 6, 2025

UPVX Honor Code

By enrolling in a course on UPVX, you become part of a global open learning community driven by the Universitat Politècnica de València (UPV). Our goal is to offer quality, accessible, and free training, fostering autonomous learning, curiosity, and academic integrity.

1. Collaboration Policy

Your participation contributes to the success of this community. UPVX trusts your motivation to learn and act honestly in all your activities. By using UPVX, you agree to comply with this Honor Code and the specific conditions that may apply to each course or program, available on their respective pages.

2. Commitment to the Honor Code

By enrolling in a course or program at UPVX, I agree that:

  • I will personally complete all tests, quizzes, and evaluation activities, unless it is expressly stated that collaboration is permitted.
  • I will maintain a single user account, linked to my truthful personal data.
  • I will not share my username or password with anyone else.
  • I will not participate in any dishonest activity that alters my results or negatively affects the experience of other students.
  • I will not post solutions or answers to exercises or evaluation tests, unless expressly authorized by the teaching team.

3. Violations

Failure to comply with this Honor Code or the Platform's Terms of Use may result, at the discretion of the UPVX team or the university responsible for the course, in one or more of the following measures:

  • Cancellation of the affected activity or evaluation.
  • Withdrawal of the certificate of achievement obtained.
  • Expulsion from the course or from the UPVX platform.

Violations will be evaluated by the academic team responsible for the course and, where appropriate, by UPV staff responsible for platform management. The participant will be informed of the decision made and the corresponding measures.

4. Modification of the Honor Code

UPVX may update this Honor Code to reflect regulatory, technical, or pedagogical changes. Any modification will be published on this same page with the date of last update. By continuing to use the platform after the publication of changes, you will be deemed to accept the new text.
